tossup_question: 3) MATH  Which of the following describes an inflection?
tossup_MCQoptions:
W) The point where the graph of a function has a discontinuity and where the concavity changes
X) The point where the graph of a function has a tangent line and where the concavity changes 
Y) The point where the graph of a function has a tangent line and the concavity does not change
Z) None of the above
tossup_answer: ANSWER: X) The point where the graph of a function has a tangent line and where the concavity changes
bonus_question: 3) MATH  What kind of an asymptote does a graph of a rational function have if the degree of the numerator is one greater than the degree of a denominator?
bonus_MCQoptions:
W) Vertical Asymptote
X) Horizontal Asymptote
Y) Oblique Asymptote
Z) All of the above are possible
